metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13775 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a denial of service issue in ReadJNXImage() in coders/jnx.c whereby large amounts of CPU and memory resources may be consumed although the file itself does not support the requests. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-8
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-8
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-8
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-8
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-8').
